subject: Re: Just replaced my 3.7 jar with 3.8
msgSnippet: Hmmm....I didn t change any code, I just dropped the jar in place, then pointed the IDE at it.  None of the class path dependencies changed within the code
messageBody:
Hmmm....I didn't change any code, I just dropped the jar in place,
then pointed the IDE at it. None of the class path dependencies
changed within the code either. I swapped 3.7 back in, and it works
just fine.

Which leads me to ask...what are the results of the test on the box
that this was developed on? And does 3.7 still work on the same box?

:)

-Eric

--- In junit@y..., "Vladimir Bossicard" <vbossica@t...> wrote:
> > Now when I try to run our AllTests suite, I get the
> > following error:
>
> > Failed to invoke suite():
> > java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError com/ibm/rmi/iiop/ORB
>
> My first guess is a classpath problem, but it may not be it.
>
> > Did something major changed from 3.7 to 3.8 that would
> > cause this?
>
> the invocation of the 'suite()' method has not changed (afask) but
the
> constructor of the TestCase has.
>
> If you have in your suite() method: mySuite.addTest(new
> myTestCase("testXYZ")); and if you have changed your TestCase class
to not have
> the famous constructor myTestCase(String name) { super(name); }
anymore, maybe
> (I said maybe) this will cause problems with the suite() method.
>
> My 2 cents and I'm not sure if they are worth anything :-)
>
> -Vladimir
>
> --
> Vladimir Bossicard
> www.bossicard.com
